analysis.title: The Revenant
analysis.author: Mark L. Smith
analysis.logline: After being mauled by a grizzly bear and left for dead by his companions, a frontier trapper survives impossible odds to seek brutal revenge against the men who abandoned him.

concept.justification: Extraordinary true survival story with a compelling revenge narrative that transcends typical western genre expectations

structure.justification: Masterful three-act structure with precise narrative momentum, episodic survival challenges that build dramatic tension

protagonist.justification: Hugh Glass is an extraordinary character - physically and emotionally complex, driven by primal survival instinct and righteous vengeance

supporting_cast.justification: Distinct characters with clear motivations, particularly Fitzgerald as a nuanced antagonist and Bridger as a conflicted young man

dialogue.justification: Sparse, period-appropriate dialogue that reveals character through subtext and minimal exposition

genre_execution.justification: Transcends western genre with brutal realism, psychological depth, and innovative survival sequences

originality.justification: Fresh perspective on survival narrative, integrating Native American perspectives and challenging racial dynamics of frontier era

target_audience.note: Broad appeal across adult demographics interested in survival stories

cast_attachability.note: Extraordinary lead role with complex character arc

marketing_hook.note: Visual survival story with clear trailer moments

budget_return_ratio.note: Moderate production costs balanced by strong narrative

comparable_success.note: Similar to critically and commercially successful survival narratives

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Inciting incident: Grizzly attack, Act 2 turning point: Glass's survival journey, Act 3: Revenge pursuit

characters.protagonist: Hugh Glass - African American frontiersman seeking survival and revenge, defined by extraordinary resilience
characters.antagonist: John Fitzgerald - Racist, self-interested trapper who abandons Glass and kills his companions

standout_scenes.why: Brutally realistic, viscerally intense survival moment that defines protagonist's journey
Demonstrates protagonist's extraordinary survival instinct and resilience

budget_tier.justification: Complex production requiring extensive location shooting, period authenticity, and potential visual effects

assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptional screenplay demonstrating extraordinary craft, commercial viability, and artistic ambition. Weighted score of 8.80 with no critical failures and CVS of 17/18 makes this an immediate greenlight candidate.

film_now_assessment.lightning_test: Grizzly bear attack sequence immediately establishes high stakes and protagonist's extraordinary resilience
goosebumps_moments: Page 15: Glass's brutal fight with grizzly bear
Page 38: Glass burning his own throat wound
film_now_assessment.career_risk_test: Absolutely. This screenplay represents a landmark storytelling achievement.
film_now_assessment.legacy_potential: High - represents a transformative narrative about human survival and racial dynamics in frontier America

analysis.verdict_statement: FILM NOW: THE REVENANT represents exceptional material that demands immediate greenlight consideration. The Lightning: A brutally realistic survival revenge narrative that redefines the western genre. The Craft: Weighted score of 8.80 with no dimension below 8. The Commercial Case: CVS of 17/18. Leonardo DiCaprio presents extraordinary star potential. Urgency: This screenplay will not remain available.
